name: Ayutthaya
fun_fact: Fun fact: Ayutthaya was once one of the world's largest cities with a population of 1 million in 1700 - bigger than London or Paris at the time! The Burmese burned it to the ground in 1767, leaving the haunting ruins we see today.

hero_dishes.name: Boat Noodles (Kuay Teow Rua)
hero_dishes.description: Small bowls of pork or beef noodle soup with blood, served rapidly
hero_dishes.origin_story: Originally sold from boats on the canals - Ayutthaya's klongs were once its highways. Bowls are small so you eat many
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Boat noodle restaurants near Wat Mahathat, floating restaurants

hero_dishes.name: Roti Sai Mai
hero_dishes.description: Thin roti pancake filled with colorful candy floss threads
hero_dishes.origin_story: Ayutthaya's signature sweet - Muslim traders brought roti, Thais added the cotton candy filling. Pink, green, and white threads
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Stalls along U Thong Road, especially near Chao Phrom Market

hero_dishes.name: Hoy Tod
hero_dishes.description: Crispy mussel or oyster pancake with egg and bean sprouts
hero_dishes.origin_story: A popular street food throughout Thailand, excellent along the river
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Chao Phrom Night Market, riverside restaurants

hero_dishes.name: Giant River Prawns
hero_dishes.description: Enormous freshwater prawns grilled with their heads intact
hero_dishes.origin_story: The Chao Phraya River produces massive prawns - Ayutthaya is famous for them
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Riverside restaurants, especially Ban Kao restaurant

signature_drinks.name: Nam Krajiab
signature_drinks.description: Iced roselle (hibiscus) drink, ruby red and refreshing
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At temples and street stalls - perfect for temple-hopping in the heat

signature_drinks.name: Cha Yen
signature_drinks.description: Thai iced tea with condensed milk
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: From street vendors in plastic bags

food_culture_notes: Ayutthaya Night Market near ruins has excellent street food
Elephant riding was once popular but ethical concerns now prevail
Easy day trip from Bangkok (80km) - many food tours available
Chao Phrom Market is the local favorite for authentic food
